position_management.description: Nuanced position management - when to add, when to hold, when to cut. Context matters. Trade type matters. Thesis status matters.
position_management.core_principle: There is no single rule. Every decision depends on WHAT KIND OF TRADE this is and WHAT THE THESIS STATUS is.

momentum_trades.definition: Quick plays based on price action, volume, and movement. No fundamental thesis required.
momentum_trades.management_style: STRICT rules, quick decisions, no emotional attachment
momentum_trades.loss_tolerance: LOW - cut fast if momentum dies

thesis_trades.definition: Positions based on fundamental research, catalysts, and conviction.
thesis_trades.thesis_requirement: REQUIRED - must know WHY you own this
thesis_trades.management_style: PATIENT, hold through volatility, trust the research
thesis_trades.loss_tolerance: HIGHER - red days don't mean thesis is broken

when_to_add_on_dips.description: Adding to a losing position can be smart OR stupid. Context determines which.

thesis_intact.condition: The reason you bought hasn't changed. The stock is just down.
thesis_intact.example: MU down 5% on market-wide selloff. AI memory demand hasn't changed. Jensen still bullish. ADD.
thesis_intact.logic: You liked it at $410, you should LOVE it at $390 if nothing fundamental changed.

catalyst_still_coming.condition: The event you're waiting for hasn't happened yet.
catalyst_still_coming.example: UUUU down but ASM acquisition still closing June 2026. Catalyst intact. ADD.
catalyst_still_coming.logic: You're waiting for X. X hasn't happened. Price is lower. Better entry for same catalyst.

sector_rotation_temporary.condition: Whole sector is down, not just your stock. Rotation will come back.
sector_rotation_temporary.example: All uranium names down 8% on profit taking. Uranium spot still $88. Sector thesis intact. ADD.
sector_rotation_temporary.logic: Sector rotations are temporary. When money comes back, your names run.

volume_dry_on_decline.condition: Stock drifting down on LOW volume. No one is actually selling hard.
volume_dry_on_decline.example: RCAT down 3% but volume is 40% of normal. Just drift, not distribution. ADD on strength.
volume_dry_on_decline.logic: Low volume decline = weak hands shaking out. High volume decline = real selling.

you_have_cash_and_conviction.condition: You have available capital AND you believe in the trade.
you_have_cash_and_conviction.logic: Adding to losers only works if you're RIGHT about the thesis. Make sure you are.

thesis_is_broken.condition: The reason you bought no longer exists.
thesis_is_broken.example: Bought biotech for FDA approval, FDA rejected. Thesis DEAD. Don't add, CUT.
thesis_is_broken.logic: Adding to a broken thesis is throwing money away.

catalyst_failed.condition: The event you were waiting for happened and it was BAD.
catalyst_failed.example: Earnings missed badly. Guidance cut. Contract lost. Don't add. Reassess.
catalyst_failed.logic: The thing you were waiting for went wrong. Time to exit, not double down.

you_dont_know_why_its_down.condition: Stock is tanking and you have no idea why.
you_dont_know_why_its_down.example: Down 15% and you can't find any news. DON'T ADD until you understand.
you_dont_know_why_its_down.logic: Someone knows something you don't. Find out first.

its_a_momentum_trade.condition: This was never a thesis trade. You bought for movement, movement is gone.
its_a_momentum_trade.example: MRNO momentum died, now drifting down. Don't add. Momentum trades get CUT, not averaged.
its_a_momentum_trade.logic: Momentum trades live and die by momentum. No momentum = no trade.

youre_already_overweight.condition: This position is already too big relative to portfolio.
youre_already_overweight.logic: Adding makes a bad situation worse. Cut before adding.

youre_emotional.condition: You want to add because you're angry about the loss, not because the thesis is good.
youre_emotional.logic: Revenge trading loses money. Step back. Reassess when calm.

when_to_hold_through_red.description: Red candles are not automatic sell signals. Sometimes holding is right.

thesis_intact.condition: Nothing fundamental has changed. Just price moving.
thesis_intact.example: IBRX was down some days. Thesis never broke. Held. Now up 55%.
thesis_intact.lesson: DNN - we panic sold at -3.78%, it ran +6.49% after. HOLDING would have won.

market_wide_selloff.condition: Everything is red. It's not your stock, it's the market.
market_wide_selloff.logic: If SPY is down 2%, your small cap being down 4% is normal. Hold.

approaching_catalyst.condition: Your catalyst is days/weeks away. Don't sell before the event.
approaching_catalyst.example: LUNR down but Artemis II is Feb 6. Hold for the catalyst.
approaching_catalyst.logic: You bought for the event. Wait for the event.

stop_loss_not_hit.condition: You set a stop. It hasn't been hit. Trust your plan.
stop_loss_not_hit.logic: You made the plan with a clear head. Trust past-you.

thesis_broken.condition: The reason you bought is gone.

stop_loss_hit.action: SELL. Honor your rules. That's what stops are for.

better_opportunity.condition: Capital tied up in a drifting position could work harder elsewhere.
better_opportunity.logic: Opportunity cost is real. Dead money should be redeployed.

when_to_cut_losses.description: Sometimes you have to take the L. Knowing when is critical.

thesis_broken.condition: The fundamental reason for the trade no longer exists.
thesis_broken.action: SELL AT OPEN. Don't wait. Don't hope.

no_thesis_existed.condition: You never had a real reason. You chased without thinking.
no_thesis_existed.example: NTLA - bought on nothing, bleeding -11%, no catalyst, no thesis. CUT.
no_thesis_existed.lesson: This is the tax on undisciplined trading. Pay it and learn.

momentum_trade_momentum_died.example: MRNO below $1.80 = momentum failed. CUT. Don't hold momentum trades like thesis trades.
momentum_trade_momentum_died.logic: Momentum trades have no thesis to fall back on. When movement stops, exit.

stop_loss_hit.action: SELL. Period. You made the rule for a reason.
stop_loss_hit.warning: Moving your stop down when losing is how small losses become big losses.

down_20_plus_without_catalyst.condition: Position down 20%+ and there's no imminent catalyst to save it.
down_20_plus_without_catalyst.logic: You need +25% just to get back to even. Is that realistic? If not, cut and redeploy.

dead_money_for_weeks.condition: Position just sitting there, not moving, no catalyst in sight.
dead_money_for_weeks.logic: That capital could be making money elsewhere. Cut the dead weight.

you_keep_checking_hoping.condition: You're checking the price 10x a day hoping it recovers.
you_keep_checking_hoping.logic: If you're hoping instead of knowing, your thesis is already broken. Cut it.

just_because_red.condition: Stock is down but thesis is intact.
just_because_red.logic: Red candles != sell signal. Ask: has anything CHANGED?

panic.condition: You're scared and want to stop the pain.
panic.logic: Panic selling locks in losses. Breathe. Check thesis. Then decide.
panic.example: DNN - panic sold, missed the recovery. Don't repeat.

market_volatility.condition: Whole market is volatile but your thesis is solid.
market_volatility.logic: Volatility is normal. Ride it if thesis intact.

position_sizing_adjustments.description: How to size based on conviction and trade type

adding_to_winners.when: Thesis playing out, stock confirming, want more exposure
adding_to_winners.how: Add in smaller increments (half original size)
adding_to_winners.warning: Don't let winners become too large a % of portfolio

adding_to_losers.when: Thesis intact, better price, catalyst still ahead
adding_to_losers.how: Add SMALLER than original position (quarter to half size)
adding_to_losers.rule: Never add more than your original position to a loser
adding_to_losers.warning: Adding to losers can be brilliant or devastating. Be honest about thesis.

scaling_out.at_first_target: Sell 1/3 to 1/2, let rest ride with trailing stop
scaling_out.moon_shot: Keep small piece for potential blowoff top

decision_flowchart.description: How to decide what to do with a position

position_is_red.step_1: What kind of trade is this?

if_momentum.if_no: CUT immediately - momentum trades don't get averaged

if_yes.next_check: Is there a catalyst still coming?

position_is_green.if_yes: Consider scaling out, setting trailing stop

if_no.if_no: Take profits - if thesis is done, so is trade

considering_new_entry.step_1: Do I have a thesis? (If no, STOP)
considering_new_entry.step_2: Is there a catalyst? (If no, be cautious)
considering_new_entry.step_4: What's my stop loss? (Define before entry)
considering_new_entry.step_6: How big should position be? (Size to conviction)

IBRX_success.entry: Bought on high convergence (85) + strong volume (2.8x)
IBRX_success.lesson: Thesis trades get patience. Red candles aren't sell signals.

DNN_mistake.lesson: Panic selling thesis trades = giving away gains. Should have held.

NTLA_mistake.lesson: No thesis = no recovery path. Cut and learn.

MRNO_momentum.entry: Bought on volume spike + low float
MRNO_momentum.lesson: Momentum trades need STRICT rules. No thesis to fall back on.

thesis_names_jan_27.lesson: Thesis-driven trades WIN more often. This is data, not opinion.

non_thesis_jan_27.lesson: Non-thesis trades LOSE more often. The math is clear.

how_it_works.year_1: Brain is a true trading edge

compound_learning.principle: Each day builds on the last. Intelligence compounds like interest.
compound_learning.example: Day 1 you know nothing. Day 30 you have 30 days of decisions. Day 365 you have a year of patterns.
